reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a great stay at La Guriniere, just outside of Paris. Micheline and Jean Paul are excellent hosts and made us feel at home immediately. The bedroom was bright, cosy and spacious, the shower was large, hot and powerful and the breakfast was as described by many other visitors - plenty of orange juice, hot drinks, lovely bread and jams and delicious pastries!
reviews.title: Lovely hosts!
A cozy, comfortable escape
reviews.text: Micheline recommended a couple of places nearby to eat in the evening, which we tried ; Il Pomodoro (owned by Toto who's Sicilian and serves tasty pasta/pizza) and Le Timbre Poste (a 'pub' selling very nice food).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Book to stay at La Guriniere and you won't be disappointed - we will definitely return......
reviews.title: Fantastic French Accommodation
40th Birthday celebration
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at La Guriniere over the New Year's holiday, it was perfect. The pictures we had seen online are accurate, and it truly is easy to get to. The walk to the metro takes less than five minutes, and the ride to any of the tourist spots is quick. The breakfasts were as described and tasty, and our hosts made the stay pleasant and fun.

reviews.title: A lovely B&B close to Paris
reviews.text: When staying at a true B&B, as this one (only three rooms and the proprietors live on site), the service will not be consistent from day to day. This is understandable given the fact that there is only Micheline and Jean Paul to tend to the place. The service varied from excellent to average, but never below. Micheline was taken ill during our stay, and so there were a couple of days that our bed was not made, but that was okay. We found our time to be a wonderful escape from the cold and hectic city. Unlike many hotels, La Guriniere is a place to retreat to. People go to Paris to see Paris, but forget that resting and recharging are essential to an enjoyable visit. For us, La Guriniere provided a peaceful backdrop to our stay. It was a place we enjoyed retreating to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in the earlier part of September and we were both astounded as to how wonderful staying at the La Guriniere was. We stayed in the blue room which was cozy, comfortable and clean. The bathroom had ample space and was spotless. Micheline has a very beautiful garden where you can sit and enjoy the mornings or evenings. The location of the the B&B was maybe a 3 minute walk to the metro, so very convenient. The neighborhood around La Guriniere was very safe and very quiet at night.
reviews.title: Look no further...this is the place to stay. As others have said before its like staying with family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But make no mistake, the best part about staying at La Guriniere is because of Micheline and Jean Paul. They are the most wonderful people you could ever imagine staying with. Like other have said, and its true, its like staying with family. Their hospitality is second to none. I always looked forward to Micheline's breakfasts (her crossiants and jams were the best!) and the morning chats we would have before we left on our sightseeing of Paris. She is very light hearted and always willing to help out with whatever questions you have and helpful in plotting out a more efficient route for your sightseeing. I can't stress enough how much it felt to me as if I were staying with family. Micheline and Jean Paul honestly put their best foot forward in order to make your stay relaxing and enjoyable. I am definately staying with them again on my next visit to Paris. Thank you Micheline and Jean Paul for all you did for us.
reviews.title: More home than hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I were just as pleased with our second stay at La Guriniere as we were with our first. The overall welcome from Micheline and Jen-Paul makes you feel like you've returned home, rather than gone on vacation. The rooms are comfortable, the breakfasts delicious, and the garden delightful. Staying just outside Paris in Malakoff is a brilliant idea, with all the feel and scale of a neighborhood, and the sights of Paris just minutes away by Metro.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: To add a new wrinkle to your visit, you might consider walking the "coulee verte" from Malakoff into the small towns south of Paris. The 10K walk will lead you past the gorgeous Parc de Sceaux, with its grand gardens and chateau. My wife and I did that on my 60th birthday. It took the sting out of turning 60, and provided one of those memorable days that stay with you a lifetime.
reviews.title: Peaceful Spot and Warm Croissants
Like staying at a good friend's house
reviews.text: Will I be able to do it at age 61? If so, that walk too will certainly begin at La Guriniere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After all the hustle and bustle of our wedding, stepping into the courtyard of La Guriniere was like stepping into another world. Micheline's beautiful garden, the adorable country-house feel of the guest-house, the exposed stone wall of the "yellow room", it was exactly what we wanted.
reviews.title: Perfect kick-off to our honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in Paris before heading off to Amsterdam and then Jamaica, and while some of our other accommodation was grander and more luxurious, La Guriniere was cute, cozy and warm: everything you want for your first few days (and nights) of married life. The b&b is just outside of Paris itself, but if you like to walk, you don't even need to take the metro. It's 3.5 km to Montparnasse with shopping, movies, retaurants and more; and only 6km to the centre of Paris. If you do want to save your energy, the metro is minutes away, and the town of Malakoff is a cute destination of its own.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The breakfasts were great (fresh bread and pastries, delicious coffee and juice), our hostess was welcoming and helpful, and I challenge anyone to find the same quality for the price in a traditional hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful place, it was like being at home

likes.liked: — the amability form the hosts and the cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't wait to go back. Maybe a 1-year anniversary?
reviews.title: Wish we could have stayed longer !

reviews.text: I found La Guriniere through Trip Advisor and booked our rooms months in advance by email with the owner Jean Paul Barbu(email address is on their website). He arranged to have a taxi meet us at the train station in Paris (Gare Austerlitz) as we were traveling from southwest France. We stayed four nights and were very satisfied. The rooms are spotless, bathroom modern, near king size bed was comfortable and the hostess, Micheline, was very eager to please. In addition to providing fresh croissants, baguetts & other baked goods, coffee and tea for breakfast, Micheline also called taxis for us. One evening our daughter in law who lives nearby was visiting and was going to walk home after dark but Jean Paul volunteered to drive her at no cost. The B & B sits in its own small pleasant courtyard garden separated from the street by a high wall with a locked gate (we were given a key). The neighborhood around La Guirniere isn't much too look at, but there is an excellent pub (Le Timbre Post) about 4 blocks away where we had dinner (good food) three evenings after coming back from Paris. Also three beauty parlors, a newstand, a small grocery, pharmacie, and an ATM all close by. We took taxis into Paris because one of our group has trouble walking but there is a metro connection nearby. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: "La Guriniere - La Fantastique"
Excellent French Hospitality!
reviews.text: I highly recommend a stay at La Guriniere. My buddy and I recently stayed at this bed and breakfast for 4 nights based on reviews from TripAdvisor. This turned out to be an excellent choice. Micheline is an excellent host who was very pleasant to talk to each morning about our plans for the day, the differences and similarities in French and American culture, her many interesting B&B experiences, or anything else under the sun. She was also very helpful in giving us advise on where to eat in Malakoff, do laundry, access the internet, which bus or metro line to take, etc. The breakfasts are simple but delicious. Micheline has various breads, which of course include croissants, and she has a selection of interesting and tasty jams. Coffee and orange juice accompanied our meals. The town of Malakoff has a lot of little restaurants and a cool little bar nearby (the one with a bunch of signs lit-up at night) that we visited a couple of times. There was also a neat market very nearby on the weekend in the town square. The metro is about a 15 minute walk away and you can get anywhere in the city within 20-30 minutes. If you are looking to be pampered and having access to a concierge or other hotel amenities, you are better off not staying in this or any other bed and breakfast. But if you are looking for excellent value, friendly French hospitality and company, and a nice clean place to sleep each night with a comfortable bed, then La Guriniere is absolutely the place for you. Thanks again Micheline for everything!! --Jason in Jacksonville
